intro: Korthalsia concolor, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Korthalsia concolor thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. It is popular as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
